content.full_text:
Addition to Rules for the Government of the House of Representatives, [11 December

1834]1 47. It shall not be in order, to offer amendments to any billupon^after^its third reading2
paragraphs: Addition to Rules for the Government of the House of Representatives, [11 December
1834]1 47. It shall not be in order, to offer amendments to any billupon^after^its third reading2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote all the text on page one, aside from the insertion denoted by
                  carets.Abraham Lincoln proposed this additional rule on December 11, 1834, and the House
                  rejected it.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835. 9th G. A., 1st sess., 103

2There were forty-six “Rules for the Government of the House of Representatives of
                  the State of Illinois,” and they did not limit the actions a legislator could take
                  on a bill before it passed.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835.  9th G. A., 2nd sess., 55-58.
